import numpy as np # linear algebra

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.92a75da4:
Analysis of Nobel Laureates Dataset Visualization
Access by the URL: 
(http://public.tableau.com/profile/yuanyi6537#!/vizhome/NobelDashboardNew1/birth?publish=yes
)


**DATA DESCRIPTION**
The data I found is from Kaggle, which is an online community of data scientists and machine learners, with one of the purposes is providing publish data sets to users("Kaggle", 2019). The data set can be accessed by the link: https://www.kaggle.com/nobelfoundation/nobel-laureates
As the website showed, the data is from The Nobel Foundation. It contains 969 rows and 18 columns, mainly ordered by year. However, as there is a long history of the Nobel Prize, some of the data in this data set are not updated, like some country or area is changed their name by history reason. A small part of laureates‘ information is missing, including the birth date, birth location, and gender information. I tried to filter the missing information and also corrected the location name before visualization. Overall, the data set is had high usability.
